bug.title: More complete superperms integration
bug.body: - [x] Look into how PEX respects permission defaults set in `plugin.yml` files - [x] Take into account op status as the final fallback when a user doesn't have a permission set - [x] Correct login flow so that PEX is already controlling permissions by the time the server sends command completions to the client

bug.title: [2.0] Groups disappears
bug.body: If i try to remove and add Groups via Remove: `SubjectData data = _permission.getUserSubjects().get(_player.getIdentifier()).getSubjectData(); data.removeParent(SubjectData.GLOBAL_CONTEXT, _permission.getGroupSubjects().get(group));` Add: `SubjectData data = _permission.getUserSubjects().get(_player.getIdentifier()).getSubjectData(); data.addParent(SubjectData.GLOBAL_CONTEXT, _permission.getGroupSubjects().get(group));` `_permission is an Sponge provided PermissionService` somtimes the new group disappears from users cached Subject. The parent entry for the group still exists inside `permissions.json` and returns back after `/pex reload`. PermissionsEx: 2.0-SNAPSHOT Build 123 SpongeAPI: 4.1.0-SNAPSHOT-3e39b9c MinecraftForge: 11.15.1.1808

bug.title: caching is evil
bug.body: everything is awful basically caching mysteriously breaks and all perms disappear after a while. @bloodmc is trying to reproduce

bug.title: [PEX 1.9] PermissionsEx permissions not working when changing world directory
bug.body: I've been trying to set up PermissionsEx for 1.9, but I can't seem to get it working. For instance: I can't acces any of the PEX commands, altough all the permissions are given to the 'Owner' rank. It also won't register any other permission of these mods: - UltimatePluginHider - Vault The only permission that does work is - modifyworld.*... I linked a .zip file with the server log and the permissions.yml file, is there something I did wrong or something? [Help (07032016).zip](https://github.com/PEXPlugins/PermissionsEx/files/161913/Help.07032016.zip)

bug.title: "Unless this server is configured to integrate with a supported proxy"
bug.body: Hi guys I have this error, but the link doesn't work [11:45:21 WARN]: [PermissionsEx] This server is in offline mode. Unless this server is configured to integrate with a supported proxy (see http://dft.ba/-8ous), UUIDs _may not be stable_! Can you help me please?

bug.title: Unable to remove context
bug.body: It seems I'm only able to clear out permissions for a context using the following code ` player.getSubjectData().clearPermissions(ImmutableSet.of(claim.getContext())); ` I see no way to wipe out a context from a permissions file. In GriefPrevention, players can delete claims which is the context I use in PEX. Upon deletion I want to remove all references to the context in the permissions file.

bug.title: PEX 2.0 Case sensitive user name returns incorrect information
bug.body: Version Details spongeforge-1.8-1568-2.1-DEV-833.jar forge 1568 PEX 2.0 build #49 When entering the command, /pex user Nutmegan info The returned value is: Information for user Nutmegan Nothing else. However, if I enter the same command with user name in all lower case the returned value is: Information for user ---UUID here---/Nutmegan Options: Global: name=Nutmegan Parents: Global: group: guest group: srmod It seems somewhere the code is looking for user as all lower case. --- Possibly a related issue... The first time a user joins, if you modify the permissions via user name commands a record will be created for the user under their name but with no UUID recorded. If they log out and back in, a second record with the user name and UUID will get created and will not be associated to the first entry. Allowing the user to log out and back in before making modifications prevents the disassociated records from happening. It seemed entering the user information with all lower case also prevented this.

bug.title: Prevent dupe group adds
bug.body: Currently a user can be added to a group multiple times. This does nothing but hurt performance. Should guard against this.

bug.title: 1.19.2b355 /pex reload does not reinject permissibles/recalculate permissions for logged on players.
bug.body: So what I thought was going on in #362 is actually something slightly different. By that I mean that it was not actually fixed. To reproduce: 1. Log on 2. Test an existing superperm permission, e.g. `bukkit.command.list` 3. Remove permission from backend. 4. Execute `/pex reload`. Expected result: `/list` command unavailable. Actual result: `/list` command remains available until player leaves the server and then rejoins. So yes, please make it so that `/pex reload` does in fact update superperms for players that are logged on at the time.

bug.title: Non-inheritable node character is already reserved for comments.
bug.body: http://yaml.org/spec/current.html#id2509980 > 3.2.3.3. Comments > > Comments are a presentation detail and must not have any effect on the serialization tree or representation graph. In particular, comments are not associated with a particular node. The usual purpose of a comment is to communicate between the human maintainers of a file. A typical example is comments in a configuration file. Comments may not appear inside scalars, but may be interleaved with such scalars inside collections. Isn't this just a little bit too crazy? At least two yaml parsers turn any scalar beginning with # into a null. http://instantyaml.appspot.com/ http://yaml-online-parser.appspot.com/

bug.title: Internal error
bug.body: I got a very annoying Problem. Every Time i want to use a PermissionEx command, like /pex reload or /pex users list The server shows me this error message: An internal error occured while attempting to perform this command. Also none of the default users can use the assigned commands e.g. use bridges oder /time My Plugins are: - ChatManager - Commandbook - Falsebook - Worldguard - Modify World - World Edit -PermissionsEx http://www.share-online.biz/dl/Z3NZIIYLJW In this Zip file are my: permissions.yml config.yml serverlog.txt The Online YAML parser (http://yaml-online-parser.appspot.com/) doesnt show any errors. sry for my bad englisch (first language is german)

bug.title: ChatManager only blocks colours when & symbol is used - ignores ยง
bug.body: Players who don't have the allow colours permission node are still able to talk in colour by installing the client mod ImprovedChat and pasting the ยง symbol in then choosing the colour code.

bug.title: Spout & PEX Issue
bug.body: Players cannot see console /say or certain plugin's message output. When the server 1st starts or /reloads, everything is fine. Players can see console /say. But once a player disconnects and rejoins the server, they're not able to see console /say. (Or certain plugins that output messages: FirstLastSeen.jar & AutoMessage. mcbans messages doesn't seem to be affected) Here's what we've tried: We loaded a server with just Spout & PermissionsEx (Fresh Default Configs/We let it load the files on its own). A player joins, and is able to see console say. But once he relogs, he is not able to see console /say. We pull either Spout or PermissionsEx, and restart. The issue is resolved.

bug.title: Request - Explain 'weight' option on the wiki.
bug.body: What does the weight option do? I found it in this code: https://github.com/t3hk0d3/PermissionsEx/blob/master/src/main/java/ru/tehkode/permissions/PermissionGroup.java It's not on the wiki. I don't know what it does. Help? (https://github.com/t3hk0d3/PermissionsEx/wiki)

bug.title: Suggestion - Catch unique key violation and display useful error message
bug.body: If someone tries to add a permission that already exists in the database they violate the unique key, and PermissionsEx throws an ugly error to the console. Perhaps you could catch the error response (I imagine it's a specific SQLException) and display what the cause was in a human-friendly manner?

bug.title: Conversion Fails to Recognize Default Group
bug.body: When trying to convert from Permissions 2.7.x to PEX I get errors during the file dump. The primary error is that no default group is set even though the first group in the permissions file has the default: true property.

bug.title: If name contains dot, the yaml will be broken.
bug.body: The old Permissions plugin already has this problem. For example, if a user is named `0.0.0`, the user section will become: ``` users: '0': '0': '0': group: - user ``` If a user named `0.`, then the users like `0..` , `0...`, `0....` all will be in same group.

bug.title: 1.13 Causes clientside lag
bug.body: We don't know why it does it since it doesn't give any error feed back. But all of our members lag when we switch over to pEx 1.13 from 1.12. We only load the permisisonsex.jar & permissions.jar (permcompat) and after we restart the server it starts to lag the clients. The server is fine; 20/ticks per second, but our members experience chat, block, & movement lag. If possible, I think it would be best if you can join our server and see if 1st hand.

bug.title: ModifyWorld does now track paintings and crops.
bug.body: Greetings, guests on my server have no permissions to edit or interface with any blocks or entities, yet they can affect wheat (by walking on it) and paintings (by punching them). I toggled debug mode and I don't see any checks for these items until they walk over the dropped item. 2011-08-16 11:32:45 [INFO] User xchuckyx checked for "modifyworld.items.pickup.295", no permission found 2011-08-16 11:32:45 [INFO] User xchuckyx checked for "modifyworld.items.pickup.seeds", no permission found ...etc. Permissions.yml file is available here if you'd like to verify it: http://pastebin.com/nE8LNQcq

bug.title: Debug code left in Dinnerperms
bug.body: at src/main/java/ru/tehcode/permissions/bukkit/BukkitPermissions.java line 138 outside of the isDebug() check. This is annoying a bunch of users complaining in IRC.
